newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli companies' foreign investments soar.
newsitem.headline: Israeli companies' foreign investments soar.

text.p: Israeli companies invested $860 million abroad in the first 10 months of 1996, a 61 percent increase over the same period a year earlier, the Bank of Israel said on Wednesday.
It said 1,400 Israeli companies had non-financial overseas investments, representing about 17 percent of their total capital.
Last year, Israeli companies invested $693 million abroad compared with $704 million in 1994 and 1993.
The Bank of Israel's foreign currency supervisory department reported the increase stemmed mainly from acquisitions of foreign pharmaceutical and software companies.
Israeli companies invested mainly in North America -- $459 million in the first 10 months of this year compared with $259 million in January to October 1995.
Two years ago, the Bank of Israel lifted all restrictions on the amount of non-financial investment Israeli companies could make abroad.
